newsitem.title: USA: Medaphis Healthcare unit to go public.
newsitem.headline: Medaphis Healthcare unit to go public.

text.p: Medaphis Corp said Friday it was spinning off Healthcare Recoveries Inc in an initial offering that would turn the unit into a publicly-traded company.
Medaphis, which previously announced it would divest itself of the unit as part of its 1997 operating plans, filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the offering.
The offering has an indicated value of $167.64 million, but Medaphis did not indicate the number of shares to be sold or the price per share.
The offering will be made through Bear Stearns & Co Inc, Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities Corp, and Robinson Humphrey Co.
Healthcare Recoveries will not receive proceeds from the offering, except if underwriters excercise over-allotment options to cover increased demand for the shares.
Proceeds from the exercise of such options will be used for general corporate purposes, including capital expenditures and possible acquisitions, according to the SEC filing.

Based in Louisville, Ky., Healthcare Recoveries provides services designed to recover the value of accident-related healthcare benefits provided by its clients to people who are insured, when a third party is responsible for those healthcare benefits.
Medaphis, based in Atlanta, provides transaction processing and cleint/server information technology systems and services for clients, with a concentration in healthcare.
